title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 91.12 - Court procedure for uniform traffic ticket
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 91.12 - Court procedure for uniform traffic ticket

State Regulations

When a traffic violation matter, for which a uniform
traffic ticket has been issued, has been disposed of, the court shall indicate
the disposition of the matter on part IV of the uniform traffic ticket, and
shall deliver the same to the enforcement agency whose name appears thereon. Whenever a traffic violation matter, for which a uniform traffic ticket has
been issued, results in a forfeiture of bail or a conviction, the court shall
indicate such disposition on part III of the uniform traffic ticket, and shall, after completing the reverse of such part, deliver that part to the Department
of Motor Vehicles, Albany, New York. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
91.12

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
